item.title: The Army Wants You to Make Its Soldiers Pocket-Sized Drones
item.description:
The Army Wants You to Make Its Soldiers Pocket-Sized Drones

Drones first glided into the public imagination in the early 2000s when the US Air Force and the CIA started using school bus-sized Predator and Reaper unmanned aerial vehicles for surveillance and airstrikes in the Middle East.

item.title: IBM Wants to Implant Fake Brains in Real Brains to Prevent Seizures
item.description:
IBM Wants to Implant Fake Brains in Real Brains to Prevent Seizures

Talk about neural networking. In Melbourne, Australia, Stefan Harrer is running an artificial software brain atop an artificial hardware brain in an effort to analyze a brain that isn't artificial at all. Ultimately, he and his colleagues envision merging these three brains together so that the artificial can augment the real.
